title: Heavy Rain Alert: दिल्ली के आस-पास हैं तो सावधान, तीन घंटे में इन जगहों पर गरज के साथ भारी बारिश की चेतावनी - Moneycontrol Hindi
article_text:
Heavy Rain Alert: देश आज अपनी आजादी की 79वीं वर्षगांठ मना रहा है और इस मौके पर देश के कई हिस्सों में बादल छाए हुए हैं। मौसम विभाग ने बारिश का अलर्ट जारी किया है। अगर आप दिल्ली या दिल्ली के आस-पास हैं तो सावधान रहें क्योंकि मौसम विभाग के हिसाब से अगले 3 घंटों में अलीगढ़, बागपत, जीबीनगर, गाजियाबाद, मथुरा में कुछ स्थानों पर भारी वर्षा के साथ आंधी आने और बिजली गिरने की संभावना है। पड़ोसी राज्य उत्तराखंड में मौसम विभाग ने देहरादून, नैनीताल, पौड़ी, बागेश्वर और चंपावत जिले के कुछ हिस्सों में तेज बारिश का येलो अलर्ट जारी किया है। इसके साथ ही अन्य जिलों में भी बिजली चमकने के साथ बारिश होने संभावना जताई गई है।
इन राज्यों के लिए मौसम विभाग ने जारी किया है अलर्ट
मौसम विभाग ने जो चेतावनी जारी की है, उसके मुताबिक देश के कई राज्यों में भारी बारिश के आसार हैं। दिल्ली के आस-पास बात करें तो यूपी, उत्तराखंड, हिमाचल प्रदेश, पंजाब और हरियाणा में तेज बारिश के आसार हैं। जम्मू-कश्मीर के लिए भी ऐसा अलर्ट जारी किया गया है। देश के निचले हिस्सों में जाएं तो महाराष्ट्र और गोवा होते हुए केरल, कर्नाटक, तेलंगाना तक मूसलाधार बारिश का अनुमान है। साथ ही एमपी, छत्तीसगढ़, ओडिशा, बिहार, झारखंड में भी बादल छाए रहेंगे तो पूर्वी भारत में भी अरुणाचल प्रदेश, मणिपुर, मेघालय, मिजोरम, त्रिपुरा और नागालैंड में कई जगह मूसलाधार बारिश का अलर्ट हैं।
First Published: Aug 15, 2025 8:19 AM
हिंदी में शेयर बाजार,  स्टॉक मार्केट न्यूज़,  बिजनेस न्यूज़,  पर्सनल फाइनेंस और अन्य देश से जुड़ी खबरें सबसे पहले मनीकंट्रोल हिंदी पर पढ़ें. डेली मार्केट अपडेट के लिए Moneycontrol App  डाउनलोड करें।

title: Delhi Deluge: Political Storm Brewing Over Monsoon Tragedies - Devdiscourse
article_text:
Delhi Deluge: Political Storm Brewing Over Monsoon Tragedies
The AAP criticized the BJP over severe waterlogging in Delhi after heavy rains, calling rain-related deaths 'murders'. The BJP hit back, accusing AAP of past governance failures. Incidents like tree and wall collapses have sparked a heated political debate, while Delhi's infrastructure struggles under monsoon impact.
Devdiscourse News Desk | New Delhi | Updated: 15-08-2025 01:15 IST | Created: 15-08-2025 01:15 IST
This image is AI-generated and does not depict any real-life event or location. It is a fictional representation created for illustrative purposes only.
Country: India
SHARE    

The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has accused the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) of mismanaging Delhi's infrastructure, leading to severe waterlogging and rain-related fatalities, which they termed 'murders'. This criticism emerged following heavy rains in the national capital, which resulted in infrastructural failures and multiple tragedies.

The exchange of accusations has intensified the political discourse, with BJP countering AAP by highlighting the latter's alleged failures during their own tenure, which lasted more than a decade. The AAP's former leaders, now in opposition, have been vocal in sharing devastating visuals of Delhi's streets submerged under rainwater, criticizing the current governance's preparedness.

Key incidents include the collapse of a wall in Vasant Vihar, leading to deaths, which AAP attributes to the BJP-led administration's negligence. Delhi's ruling party defended its stance, accusing AAP of politicizing tragedies and neglecting real issues when they were in power. As both sides continue to clash, citizens face increasing hardships amidst the ongoing monsoon chaos.

(With inputs from agencies.)

title: NDRF team reaches cloudburst hit Kishtwar village to join search and rescue ops - Press Trust of India
article_text:
Home > NATIONAL > NDRF team reaches cloudburst hit Kishtwar..... Back

NDRF team reaches cloudburst hit Kishtwar village to join search and rescue ops

JAMMU: (Aug 15) A team of the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) on Friday reached cloudburst-hit Chisoti village in Jammu and Kashmir''s Kishtwar district, officials said. At least 46 people have been killed in the disaster and 167 rescued.

Of those rescued on Thursday, 38 are in serious condition, officials said. The death toll went up steadily as the day progressed, and there are fears it could rise further.

"The NDRF team is joining the operation currently underway in the village. They reached Gulabgarh late in the night," Deputy Commissioner Kishtwar Pankaj Sharma told PTI.

title: J&K Kishtwar Cloudburst News Live Updates: Death toll rises to 50, army joins relief and rescue operation - The Indian Express
article_text:
03:05 (IST) 15 Aug 2025
Kishtwar Cloudburst News Live Updates: Death toll rises to 50, more than 100 injured

At least 50 people were killed and more than 100 were injured on Thursday after a cloudburst struck the remote village of Chositi in Paddar area of Jammu and Kashmir’s Kishtwar district, officials said. More than 50 people are missing.

The incident took place during the Machail Mata pilgrimage, for which Chositi is the last area where yatris can park their vehicles before resuming their journey on foot.

Kishtwar Deputy Commissioner Pankaj Kumar Sharma, who was at the site supervising rescue operations, said more than 100 people have been rushed to the sub-district hospital at Atholi. From there, around 35 have been referred to the district hospital at Kishtwar.

Kishtwar SSP Naresh Singh said more than 50 people are missing.

Rescue operations by teams of the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF), State Disaster Response Force (SDRF), security forces, police, and locals are underway. The Army has moved five columns, comprising 60 personnel each, and medical detachments to carry out relief and rescue operations, the White Knight Corps said.

title: Heavy Rain Warning for Several States on Independence Day, 15 August 2025 - Patrika News
article_text:
The Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a warning of heavy to very heavy rainfall across several states in India on Independence Day, 15 August 2025. Active weather systems in the Bay of Bengal and the Arabian Sea are expected to cause torrential rain in many parts of the country, increasing the risk of floods, landslides, and waterlogging.
Light to moderate rainfall is expected in Delhi-NCR on 15 August. The maximum temperature may be 31-33°C and the minimum 23-25°C. Waterlogging and traffic jams are possible due to rain, but the weather will be pleasant.

46 yatris dead as cloudburst triggers flash floods in J&K
The Hans India
Hans News Service | 15 Aug 2025 7:15 AM IST
HIGHLIGHTS
Rescue ops on to find 195 missing people

Jammu: At least 46 people, including two CISF jawans, died and over 120 were injured after a massive cloudburst struck Chositi village in Jammu and Kashmir’s Kishtwar on Thursday, triggering flash floods and large-scale destruction. More than 195 people are missing as rescue teams race to find survivors.

The disaster hit along the route of the Machail Mata Yatra to the Himalayan shrine of Mata Chandi, leaving the pilgrimage trail in chaos.

Rescue teams rushed to the scene immediately, with large-scale operations now underway to search for survivors and evacuate those trapped.

Videos from the site show pilgrims being hurriedly evacuated from the starting point of the yatra. Another clip captures a raging flash flood triggered by the cloudburst, with authorities shouting for people to move back to safety.

J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah said he has briefed Union Home Minister Amit Shah about the situation in the Kishtwar region. He noted that confirmed information from the cloudburst-hit area was slow to come in, but “all possible resources are being mobilised from within and beyond J&K to manage the rescue operations.”

Omar Abdullah added he would not be speaking to news outlets, and that the government would share updates as and when possible.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed his condolences and support. “My thoughts and prayers are with all those affected by the cloudburst and flooding in Kishtwar, Jammu and Kashmir. The situation is being monitored closely. Rescue and relief operations are underway. Every possible assistance will be provided to those in need,” he said.

Union Minister Jitendra Singh said the incident in Chositi, near the shrine, “could result in substantial casualties.” He said he spoke to Deputy Commissioner Pankaj Kumar Sharma after receiving an urgent alert from LoP Jammu and Kashmir and local MLA Sunil Kumar Sharma.

“The administration has immediately swung into action, and the rescue team has left for the site. Damage evacuation and necessary rescue and medical management arrangements are being made.” Jitendra Singh said.

title: 46 dead in Kishtwar cloudburst; rescue operations intensify as dozens remain missing | 10 points | Latest News India - Hindustan Times - Hindustan Times
article_text:
Subscribe Now! Get features like
At least 60 people, including two CISF personnel, have died after a massive cloudburst triggered flash floods in the remote Chasoti village of Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district on Thursday, leaving many others trapped.
Jammu and Kashmir chief minister Omar Abdullah informed on Friday that 60 people have died and over 100 were injured in the Kishtwar cloudburst.
Rescue teams have pulled 167 people from the rubble, with 38 reported in serious condition. Police on Thursday night issued an advisory putting all sub-divisions on high alert, with dedicated teams stationed to respond to emergencies as the large-scale search and rescue operation continues.
“Relief and rescue efforts in Chasoti village continue in full swing, with dedicated police teams operating across all impacted areas to trace the missing,” PTI quoted a police spokesperson as saying.

article_text:
Himachal Weather: शिमला समेत 6 जिलों में भारी बारिश, चार की मौत; कई घर-वाहन क्षतिग्रस्त, चलती बस पर गिरा मलबा
अमर उजाला ब्यूरो, शिमला/धर्मशाला। Published by: अंकेश डोगरा Updated Fri, 15 Aug 2025 09:28 AM IST
सार
Himachal Weather : हिमाचल प्रदेश में बारिश और भूस्खलन से कई जगह तबाही का मंजर देखने को मिल रहा है। मंडी जिले के सरकाघाट में चलती निजी बस पर पहाड़ी से मलबा गिरने से खिड़की तोड़कर यात्रियों को निकाला गया। पढ़ें विस्तार से...
मंडी के सरकाघाट में चलती निजी बस पर पहाड़ी से गिरा मलबा। - फोटो : संवाद न्यूज एजेंसी
5
5

मौसम विभाग के ऑरेंज अलर्ट के बीच शिमला समेत हिमाचल के छह जिलों में झमाझम बारिश से भारी नुकसान हुआ है। बुधवार रात और वीरवार को भारी बारिश-भूस्खलन से 4 लोगों की मौत हो गई, जबकि कई घर क्षतिग्रस्त हो गए हैं। जगह-जगह वाहन मलबे में दब गए हैं। पहाड़ी से गिरे पत्थर से चंबा में मणिमहेश यात्री और रामपुर में एक युवती की जान चली गई।

5.5L cusecs flood water released from Prakasam Barrage
Md Ameen
Hans News Service | 15 Aug 2025 7:57 AM IST

Surplus water being released from Prakasam Barrage in Vijayawada on ThursdayPhoto: Ch Venkata Mastan

HIGHLIGHTS
Vijayawada: With major reservoirs in the Krishna basin reaching their full capacity, authorities are releasing large volumes of floodwater, putting...

Vijayawada: With major reservoirs in the Krishna basin reaching their full capacity, authorities are releasing large volumes of floodwater, putting downstream districts on high alert.

On Thursday, more than 2.37 lakh cusecs of water was released from the Nagarjuna Sagar reservoir, while over 1.97 lakh cusecs were discharged from Srisailam. Downstream at the Prakasam Barrage near Vijayawada, outflows reached over 5.50 lakh cusecs by 5 p.m.

The continuous inflows are a result of heavy rains in the catchment areas of Maharashtra and Karnataka, which have been feeding the Srisailam and Nagarjuna Sagar reservoirs for over a week. Additionally, heavy rainfall in the Pulichintala reservoir catchment area has contributed to the massive inflows at the Prakasam Barrage.

In response, the water resources department has lifted all 70 crest gates of the Prakasam Barrage to release water into the sea. The Krishna and Guntur district administrations are on high alert, with the state government closely monitoring the situation.

Currently, key reservoirs like Pulichintala, Nagarjuna Sagar, and Srisailam hold over 80% of their storage capacity. Across the state’s three major river basins — Krishna, Godavari, and Penna — the total storage capacity is 908 TMC. As of Thursday evening, these reservoirs held 560 tmc ft. With more rain expected, officials anticipate further increases in water levels, particularly in the Godavari and Penna basins.

title: Haryana Weather Update: हरियाणा में आज फिर होगी भारी बारिश, इन जिलों के लिए अलर्ट हुआ जारी - naya haryana
article_text:
Home
हरियाणा

Haryana Weather Update: हरियाणा में आज फिर होगी भारी बारिश, इन जिलों के लिए अलर्ट हुआ जारी 

By Sahab Ram Updated: Aug 15, 2025, 08:19 IST 
Haryana Weather Update: हरियाणा में 21 अगस्त तक बारिश होने की संभावना है। इसके साथ मौसम विभाग ने आज यानी 15 अगस्त के लिए बारिश का येलो अलर्ट जारी किया है। जिसके चलते प्रदेश के कई हिस्सों में आज भारी बारिश की संभावना है। आइए जानते हैं कि आज कहां- कहां बारिश हो सकती है। 

मौसम विभाग की मानें तो आज पंचकूला, अंबाला, यमुनानगर, हिसार, भिवानी, रोहतक, चरखी ददरी, झज्जर, महेंद्रगढ़, रेवाड़ी, गुरुग्राम, मेवात डिस्ट्रिक्ट्स में मध्यम से भारी बारिश होने की संभावना है।  इसके अलावा चंडीगढ़, कुरुक्षेत्र, कैथल, करनाल, पानीपत, सोनीपत, जिंद, सिरसा और फतेहाबाद डिस्ट्रिक्ट्स में बारिश की संभावना बनी हुई है।

वहीं आज पंचकूला, अंबाला, यमुनानगर, भिवानी, चरखी ददरी, महेंद्रगढ़, रेवाड़ी डिस्ट्रिक्ट्स में भारी बारिश की संभावना बनी हुई है। जिसके चलते किसी भी वक्त मौसम बदल सकता है और बारिश शुरू हो सकती है।

कल से एक्टिव होगा पश्चिमी विक्षोभ 

बता दें कि हरियाणा में गुरुवार को भी भारी बारिश हुई थी। जिसके चलते कई इलाकों में बाढ जैसे हालात बने हुए है। वहीं मौसम विभाग का कहना है कि 16 अगस्त से एक पश्चिमी विक्षोभ एक्टिव होगा। जिसके चलते प्रदेश में 21 अगस्त तक मौसम परिवर्तनशील रहेगा।

title: Heavy Rains Return to Coastal Karnataka; Alerts Issued Till August 20 - newskarnataka.com
article_text:
HomeMangaluruHeavy Rains Return to Coastal Karnataka; Alerts Issued Till August 20Image: PixabayMangaluruHeavy Rains Return to Coastal Karnataka; Alerts Issued Till August 20By News Karnataka14 August 202510:20 pmShareCopy linkMangaluru: After a brief lull, heavy rains have returned to the coastal districts of Karnataka, with Mangaluru experiencing continuous showers since Thursday morning.
According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), the southwest monsoon is set to intensify over the next week. A yellow alert has been issued for several districts — Dakshina Kannada, Udupi, Uttara Kannada, Belagavi, Bidar, Kalaburagi, Vijayapura, Chikkamagaluru, and Shivamogga — warning of heavy rain until August 20.
For the coastal belt, a yellow alert will remain in effect until August 17, after which rainfall is expected to strengthen further. The IMD has issued an orange alert for very heavy rain on August 18, 19, and 20. Additionally, thunderstorms with lightning are forecast for August 14 and 15.
Rainfall reports from Wednesday show Aland (Kalaburagi) and Agumbe (Shivamogga) each receiving 5 cm of rain, while Manki (Uttara Kannada), Kundapur (Udupi), Shakti Nagar (Dakshina Kannada), Kukkeri (Yadgir), and Kumta (Uttara Kannada) recorded 4 cm each.
Authorities have urged residents in low-lying and flood-prone areas to remain cautious as the monsoon intensifies.Read AlsoYellow Alert as Heavy Rains to Lash Coastal Karnataka14 August 2025

title: Heavy Rain Likely In Four Odisha Districts In Next Three Hours: IMD - Ommcom News
article_text:
Bhubaneswar: Moderate thunderstorms, rain and lightning with wind speed 30-40 is very likely to occur at a few places in four in next three hours, according to the prediction of the India Meteorological Department.

According to a nowcast warning issued in this regard at 9.07 am, Kalahandi, Nabarangapur, Nuapada and Puri are likely to experience moderate thunderstorms and rain.

For today, the IMD has issued an orange warning for Rayagada and Gajapati districts, forecasting that heavy to very heavy rain and thunderstorms with lightning and gusty surface winds reaching 30-40 kmph.

Besides, a yellow warning has been issued for several other districts, including Koraput, Malkangiri, Ganjam, Nayagarh, Kalahandi, Nabarangapur, Mayurbhanj, Keonjhar, Dhenkanal, Sundargarh, Cuttack, Jajpur, Balasore, Bhadrak, Kendrapara, Jagatsinghpur, Puri, Khurda, Angul, Boudh, and Kandhamal, where heavy rain and thunderstorms with lightning and gusty surface winds reaching 30-40 kmph.

title: 10 Hidden Waterfalls in Kerala Worth Trekking to This Monsoon - Moneycontrol
article_text:
See the top gainers, losers, invest and get updated what's happening in the crypto market
This functionality will provide users with ease of access navigation and enable create a new revenue line by generating leads of potential customers for brokers in a more integrated manner.
Kerala, with its lush hills and abundant rain, transforms into a waterfall paradise during the monsoon. Beyond the well-known tourist spots, the state hides several lesser-known cascades that offer adventure, serenity, and pristine beauty. Here are ten hidden waterfalls worth trekking to this season.
1. Meenmutty Falls, Wayanad
One of Wayanad’s tallest waterfalls, Meenmutty, can be reached after a moderate jungle trek. The three-tiered cascade offers panoramic views, especially when the monsoon swells its flow.
2. Thusharagiri Falls, Kozhikode
Named for its “snowy spray,” Thusharagiri consists of multiple falls hidden within dense forests. Trekkers can explore connecting trails leading to smaller, untouched streams.
3. Chethalayam Falls, Wayanad
Less crowded than other spots, Chethalayam requires a scenic hike through spice plantations. The surrounding forest is home to diverse birdlife, making it a favourite for nature lovers.
4. Adyanpara Falls, MalappuramThis seasonal fall gushes with full force during the monsoon, surrounded by thick vegetation. The short trek to reach it is ideal for beginners.
5. Kumbhavurutty Falls, KollamBordering Tamil Nadu, this lesser-known waterfall is accessible through the Shendurney Wildlife Sanctuary. It’s perfect for combining trekking with wildlife spotting.
6. Perunthenaruvi Falls, PathanamthittaA wide and powerful cascade on the Pamba River, this spot is ideal for photography and picnics, especially after monsoon rains.
7. Attukal Falls, MunnarHidden between Munnar and Pallivasal, this fall requires a rugged trek. The mist-covered hills in the backdrop make it incredibly photogenic.
8. Soochipara Falls, WayanadAlso called Sentinel Rock Falls, this three-tiered beauty is surrounded by tea estates. The trail to it is as captivating as the fall itself.
9. Arippara Falls, KozhikodeA lesser-explored cascade on the Iruvanjippuzha River, ideal for a refreshing dip after trekking through its forested surroundings.
10. Palaruvi Falls, KollamMeaning “stream of milk,” Palaruvi offers a 300-foot drop amid lush greenery. It’s accessible after a short uphill walk through the forest.
Exploring these hidden gems during the monsoon offers not just natural beauty but also the thrill of discovery — a perfect combination for trekking enthusiasts.

title: पंजाब के तीन जिलों में भारी बारिश की चेतावनी, बाढ़ को लेकर भी अलर्ट जारी - Arth Parkash
article_text:
Heavy rain warning in three districts of Punjab: पंजाब में बारिश का दौर जारी है। मौसम विभाग ने पठानकोट, होशियारपुर और रूपनगर में भारी बारिश की चेतावनी जारी की है। बीते दिन होशियारपुर में सबसे ज्यादा 62 मिमी बारिश दर्ज की गई।
अमृतसर में सभरां ब्रांच नहर रईया के पास ओवरफ्लो हो गई। इससे तीन गांवों में पानी भर गया। जिला प्रशासन ने स्थानीय लोगों की मदद से बचाव कार्य किया। देर रात तक नहर के ओवरफ्लो वाले हिस्से को भर दिया गया।
होशियारपुर में हिमाचल से आने वाली नदी-नाले उफान पर हैं। भंगी-चो भी ओवरफ्लो होकर बह रहा है। पुलिस ने लोगों से प्रमुख पुलों का ही प्रयोग करने की अपील की है।
बारिश के कारण पंजाब का तापमान सामान्य से 4.4 डिग्री नीचे गिर गया है। विभिन्न जिलों में दर्ज की गई बारिश इस प्रकार है - लुधियाना 18 मिमी, अमृतसर 14 मिमी, मोहाली 14.5 मिमी, एसबीएस नगर 15 मिमी, रूपनगर 10.5 मिमी, पठानकोट 4 मिमी और पटियाला में 1 मिमी दर्ज की गई।
बता दें कि ठानकोट, होशियारपुर और रूपनगर में भारी बारिश की चेतावनी जारी होने के बाद प्रशासन अलर्ट पर है। वहीं बीते दिन भी कई जिलों में बाढ़ जैसे हालात बन गए थे।

title: Guwahati: Mayor inspects flood-hit areas, orders expedited drainage work - sentinelassam.com
article_text:
Guwahati: Guwahati Mayor Mrigen Sarania, accompanied by MIC Member Ashim Saikia and senior GMC officials, on Thursday inspected flood-affected localities at Anil Nagar and Dispur Last Gate near the Clock Tower.
The team assessed waterlogging, infrastructure damage, and the hardships faced by residents, while reviewing ongoing relief operations and dewatering measures. The Mayor instructed officials to speed up drainage work to minimise public inconvenience and called for close inter-departmental coordination for effective flood mitigation. Sarania assured residents of both immediate relief measures and long-term drainage solutions to address the city’s recurring flood problem.
Also read: Guwahati: GMC commissioner inspects measures for waterlogging

title: Nagaland Braces For Heavy Rainfall; Flood Risk In Lowland And Foothill Areas - Northeast Today
article_text:
NET Web Desk

Nagaland is expected to receive moderate to heavy rainfall with thunderstorms from August 16 to 19. Tinojongshi Chang, Deputy Commissioner and head of the District Disaster Management Authority, Dimapur, warned that heavy precipitation in the hill areas may lead to waterlogging, flash floods, and riverbank overflow in lowland and foothill districts, including Dimapur.

Residents have been advised to avoid rivers, streams, and other flood-prone areas as rising water levels could pose life-threatening risks.

title: Gujarat rain forecast : ગુજરાતમાં મેઘો ફરી એક્ટિવ મોડમાં, આજે 17 જિલ્લાઓમાં પડશે ભારે વરસાદ - Indian Express - Gujarati
article_text:
Aaj Nu Havaman, Gujarat weather Rain Forecast Update: ગુજરાતમાં મેઘો એકવાર ફરીથી એક્ટિવ મોડમાં આવી ગયો છે. મધ્યથી દક્ષિણ ગુજરાતના મોટભાગના વિસ્તારોમાં મેઘ મહેર રહી હતી. વરસાદની માત્રા પણ ત્રણ ઈંચ સુધી થઈ હતી. વરસાદી સિસ્ટમ ફરીથી સક્રિય થતાં હવામાન વિભાગે ભારે વરસાદની આગાહી કરી છે. હવામાન વિભાગે રાજ્યના 17 જિલ્લાઓમાં ભારે વરસાદ પડવાની શક્યતાઓ શેવી છે.
હવામાન વિભાગે રાજ્યના 17 જિલ્લાઓમાં ભારે વરસાદની આગાહી કરી છે. હવામાન વિભાગ પ્રમાણે છોટા ઉદેપુર, નર્મદા, ભરૂચ, સુરત, ડાંગ, તાપી, નવસારી, વલસાડ, દમણ, દાદરા નગર હવેલી,રાજકોટ, જૂનાગઢ, અમરેલી, ભાવનગર, ગીર સોમનાથ અને દીવમાં ભારે વરસાદ પડશે.
હવામાન વિભાગની આગાહી પ્રમાણે બનાસકાંઠા, પાટણ, મહેસાણા, સાબરકાંઠા, ગાંધીનગર, અમરેલી, ખેડા, અમદાવાદ, આણંદ, પંચમહાલ, દાહોદ, મહિસાગર, વડોદરામાં હળવાથી સામાન્ય વરસાદની શક્યતાઓ છે.
આ ઉપરાંત સુરેન્દ્રનગર, રાજકોટ, જામનગર, પોરબંદર, જૂનાગઢ, અમરેલી, ભાવનગર, મોરબી, દ્વારકા, ગીર સોમનાથ, બોટાદ અને કચ્છમાં છૂટો છવાયો વરસાદ પડશે.
જમ્મુ અને કાશ્મીરના કિશ્તવાડના ચાશોટી વિસ્તારમાં વાદળ ફાટવાથી ભારે વિનાશ થયો છે. આ અકસ્માતમાં અત્યાર સુધીમાં 38 લોકોના મોત થયા છે. અહેવાલો અનુસાર લગભગ 100 લોકો ઘાયલ થયા છે અને તેમને હોસ્પિટલમાં દાખલ કરવામાં આવ્યા છે. NDRF ટીમો ઘટનાસ્થળે બચાવ અને રાહત કાર્યમાં રોકાયેલી છે.
આ પણ વાંચોઃ- લો બોલો! સુરતમાં વર્ષ 2021 માં જે સ્કૂટર ચોરાઈ ગયું, તે વ્યક્તિને ટ્રાફિક ઉલ્લંઘન બદલ તેનું ઈ-ચલણ મળ્યું
આ દુર્ઘટના માચૈલ માતા મંદિર તરફ જવાના માર્ગ પર આવેલા છેલ્લા મોટરેબલ ગામ ચાશોટીમાં બપોરે 12 થી 1 વાગ્યાની વચ્ચે બની હતી જ્યારે મોટી સંખ્યામાં લોકો માચૈલ માતા યાત્રા માટે એકઠા થયા હતા.

title: Uttarakhand Weather: दून समेत पांच जिलों में बारिश के आसार, बाढ़ के खतरे का अंदेशा, अलर्ट जारी - Amar Ujala
article_text:
Uttarakhand Weather: दून समेत पांच जिलों में बारिश के आसार, बाढ़ के खतरे का अंदेशा, अलर्ट जारी
माई सिटी रिपोर्टर, देहरादून Published by: अलका त्यागी Updated Fri, 15 Aug 2025 09:14 AM IST
सार
44543 Followers
देहरादून
Uttarakhand Weather: 16 अगस्त को भी देहरादून, बागेश्वर और नैनीताल जिले के कुछ इलाकों में भारी से भारी बारिश का ऑरेंज अलर्ट जारी किया गया है।
उत्तराखंड में मौसम - फोटो : अमर उजाला
1
विस्तार
Follow Us

उत्तराखंड में आज भी मौसम बिगड़ा रहेगा। निचले इलाकों में हल्की बारिश से तापमान में गिरावट दर्ज की गई। वहीं, शुक्रवार को भी तेज बारिश के आसार हैं। मौसम विज्ञान केंद्र की ओर से देहरादून समेत पौड़ी, नैनीताल, बागेश्वर और चम्पावत जिले के कुछ हिस्सों में तेज बारिश का यलो अलर्ट जारी किया गया है। इसके अलावा अन्य जिलों में बिजली चमकने के साथ बारिश की संभावना है। आने वाले दिनों की बात करें तो 16 अगस्त को देहरादून, बागेश्वर और नैनीताल जिले के कुछ इलाकों में भारी से भारी बारिश का ऑरेंज अलर्ट जारी किया गया है। जबकि 18 अगस्त तक प्रदेशभर में तेज दौर की बारिश होने की संभावना है।

और पढ़ें

title: Red alert issued for very heavy to extremely heavy rain in Uttarakhand - News On AIR
article_text:
In Uttarakhand, Met Department has issued a warning for heavy to extremely heavy rainfall in several parts of the state today.

A red alert has been issued for very heavy to extremely heavy rain in Dehradun, Tehri, Pauri, Haridwar, Udham Singh Nagar, Nainital, Bageshwar, and Champawat districts.

Additionally, an orange alert is in place for heavy rain in the remaining districts of the state. In view of the heavy rainfall warning, all schools and Anganwadi centers in Dehradun, Almora, Bageshwar, Champawat, and Pauri Garhwal have been declared closed today.

Due to continuous rainfall over the past few days, the water levels of major rivers in the state have risen, and streams in hilly areas are in spate.

Landslides at several locations have disrupted road traffic, and efforts are ongoing to clear the roads and restore movement.

other_info.csv_title: Red alert issued for very heavy to extremely heavy rain in Uttarakhand - News On AIR

title: IMD issues heavy rainfall alerts for 24 districts, heavy showers could affect I-Day celebrations - Press Trust of India
article_text:
Home > NATIONAL > IMD issues heavy rainfall alerts for..... Back

IMD issues heavy rainfall alerts for 24 districts, heavy showers could affect I-Day celebrations

LUCKNOW: (Aug 14) Heavy rain alerts were issued for Thursday in 24 districts in Uttar Pradesh on Thursday, with some parts of the state set to see heavy showers on Independence Day.

In view of Wednesday night's torrential rainfall in state capital Lucknow, District Magistrate Vishak G has ordered all schools from Classes 1 to 12 to remain closed on August 14.

According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), the current monsoon spell is set to intensify in western Uttar Pradesh from Thursday, with an orange alert for very heavy rainfall issued for Saharanpur, Shamli, Muzaffarnagar, and Bijnor.
